text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen it's been 
a while since I've shared with you a Thai dessert

recipe so we are fixing that with this video I'm 
showing you a recipe that's really easy so easy

in fact we make it a lot at home it's something 
called kao niew piak lumyai so kao niew piak is sticky

rice pudding but it literally means wet sticky 
rice and lumyai is long and and long goodness of

fruit like the one on this label here yes we're 
using hand today because I can't find any fresh

right now but if you have fresh make sure you use 
fresh instead all right let's get started so the

most important thing to get right is the type 
of rice so I'm using Thai sticky rice or Thai

glutinous rice a success here sometimes it'll be 
called Thai sweet rice so just make sure you check

the label that it's from Thailand and the grains 
will be white and opaque I actually have a whole

video dedicated to Thai sticky rice so if you 
haven't seen that check it out up with the link

right up here now what you want to do with this is 
you want to just give it a rinse a couple of times

because you want to make sure you wash out any 
excess starch that's on there you'll notice the

water gets really cloudy that's the excess starch 
that you want to get rid of okay we're making rice

pudding so you don't have to be super super clean 
with it but just a couple of times is good now I'm

gonna turn it on and then my rice goes in and then 
right away some water now you're just gonna keep

the rice cooking on a gentle simmer for about 20 
minutes or until the rice has like a pudding like

consistency you don't want it to be a complete 
congee mush you still want the grains to still be

individual but it's soft and it's swollen a little 
bit you want to keep stirring frequently you don't

have to be there all the time but frequently 
otherwise the rice will start to stick to the

bottom so while the rice is simmering let's make 
our flavouring so as with most Thai desserts we're

gonna flavor this with pandan leaves so this 
is basically our vanilla as we like to say it

it's an aromatic leaves you can buy this either 
fresh or frozen at your Asian grocery store now

you could just put this into the rice pot and let 
it infuse but I want to get some green color out

of it to make it a little more interesting so I'm 
gonna blend it up so I'm gonna just cut these into

chunks throw it in my blender and then add some 
water super simple just enough to get it going

there you go and I just want to light like color 
I finally if it's too dark it's just a little bit

like mmm you know - Shrek II and so strain this 
out now all right so the rice has absorbed most

of the liquid that we put in the first time but 
super thick now it's not done yet I purposefully

put less water than it needs in the beginning so 
that we can add our pandan juice ooh and add some

color in there turn the heat back on hmm we just 
want to get that incorporated the rice is still

got a little bit of a center I can still I can see 
the core of it there's still a little bit opaque

oh look how pretty that is while this is going 
let's talk about the long guns for a second so

long guns unfortunately I can't get them all the 
time here in Vancouver but the canned ones are

actually pretty good but if you have the fresh 
ones all you have to do is just peel them take

the seeds out if you have any juices that drip 
as a result save all of that add it to your rice

pudding okay this is almost done so I'm gonna add 
my longans right now because I want the long guns

to have time to sort of infuse into the rice and 
you could cut the long guns in half but I just

find that leaving them whole is nicer and then I 
can always cut them and have what I'm eating okay

let's start with that perfect now at this point 
if you need to add more water just go ahead and

add more water so that is now done is thick and 
luscious and beautiful the rice is fully cooked

this is one of the reasons why I like to make this 
myself because when you buy this you know like on

the street in Thailand sometimes like to cut cost 
by adding a lot of water and then adding starch

to thicken the water and there's actually less 
rice per cup and I don't like that I like it to

be like rice intense rice pudding so anyway and 
then I'm gonna add my sugar and I'm using white

sugar here because I want the flavor to be quite 
clean I want the longan flavor to come out cleanly

but if you want you can do palm sugar and then a 
little bit of salt always to add some personality

oh sorry personality to that sugar I don't know 
what happened there and that is it once the sugar

dissolves you just want to give it a taste and 
the rice pudding part is done but now we have to

make the coconut sauce to go on top so the coconut 
sauce is ridiculously simple it's literally just

coconut milk a good one by the way we are making 
dessert so this is where you want to use good

quality coconut milk and I talked about which 
coconut milk is the best to buy in my coconut

milk 101 video put the link right up here make 
sure you check that out some salt and you will

notice that in Thai cuisine we do a lot of salty 
coconut sauce that we pour over desserts that are

more sweet because the salt helps balance out that 
sweetness right and now you want to make sure you

bring this to a boil even if your salt has already 
dissolved because that will help extend the shelf

life of this coconut milk and once it comes to 
a boil you are good and that's it composing this

is the funnest part so you want to put some rice 
pudding in there make sure you get enough longan

in there and then top it with our salty coconut 
sauce oh yeah now some people like to thicken

their coconut sauce so that it you know sits more 
nicely on top but I just find you're gonna mix it

in with your pudding anyway why bother right now 
this is completely optional but I like to add just

some young coconut meat on top though I got these 
from the can I can't I don't have any good fresh

ones available to me but again from the can and I 
just make sure I slice them into thin strips and

it makes for a super cute dessert topping adds a 
little texture there we go and I like to just do

a final topping with a long n just so you know 
people know right away what this pudding is all

about look how cute that is and now before you eat 
it you want to make sure you mix in the coconut

sauce and the rice pudding because I find that 
you really need the saltiness of the coconut milk

so as beautiful as this looks you got to mix it up 
and then you can always add more sauce if you feel

like it needs more salt mmm what a nostalgic smell 
so I want to make sure in this bite I have a bit

of everything oh I love that mmm there is a very 
good reason why Thai people started with these

two ingredients together I mean we make sticky 
rice pudding with various different things but

this is a classic combination the tartness of the 
longan go super well with the creaminess of the

sticky rice but it's not too tart as long and it's 
a pretty sweet fruit so it doesn't clash you know

anything more tart and this might not work like 
there's a reason why we don't put bleach in here

for example the coconut meat adds a little crunch 
the pandan the aroma of the pan and the salty

coconut milk it's just so comforting and it's 
really quite filling as you can see so you don't

really need a lot oh I need to make make a note up 
if you store this because this is rice pudding as

you store it it will continue to absorb water all 
around it so tomorrow you come look at it it'd be

super thick so when you reheat it you want to add 
a little bit of water to thin it out also only add

the coconut milk into here when you're ready to 
eat because the coconut milk is very perishable if

you say oh I'm just gonna mix everything together 
since I'm gonna mix it in the end anyway don't do

that because your rice pudding won't last and blow 
okay and that is it for today such an easy simple

very classically Thai dessert the recipe as always 
will be on hot Thai Kitchen calm when you make it

send me a photo on Facebook Twitter or Instagram 
if you haven't subscribed to the show make sure

you do so you'll go miss a delicious recipe like 
this and click that little bell icon so you get

a notification every time I post a video if you 
love the show and you want to support us check

us out on patreon the link is right below 
and I will see you next time for your name
